titles.title: Dental Health Promotion Act of 2008
Dental Health Promotion Act of 2008
A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow reimbursement from flexible spending accounts for certain dental products.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

bill.summary: Dental Health Promotion Act of 2008 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow reimbursement from flexible spending accounts for products used to diagnose, cure, mitigate, treat, or prevent the onset of tooth decay (caries), periodontal diseases, and conditions ailing the teeth, gums, and mouth, or affecting their functioning.
